text: The chapel ruins. The chapel in 1898 The chapel ruins in 2018 St. Nicholas' Chapel () was a chapel in the German city of Hanover dedicated to saint Nicholas. First built between 1250 and 1284 and with a choir dating to 1325, it was largely destroyed during the bombing of Hanover in World War II and is now in ruins. == Epitaphs at the chapel == Hannover Nikolai-Kapelle group of epitaphs.jpg|Group of epitaphs next to the chapel Hannover Nikolai-Kapelle Epitaph Epitaph Ludolf von Anderten.jpg|Epitaph for Ludolf von Anderten and his family (1601) Hannover Nikolaikapelle Epitaph for Ilsa Margareta (1654).jpg|Epitaph for ILSA MARGARE[TA?] († 1654), daughter of Justus Müller and his wife 1684 Hans Jacob Uhle Standmal Hans Hagen Nikolaikapelle (10).JPG|Epitaph for shoemaker Hans Hagen (1627–1716) and his wife Margareta Wietgrefe (1633–1697), signed "H.
